  • Uses of Tax in com.teksystems.salestaxexercise.tax

    Classes in com.teksystems.salestaxexercise.tax that implement Tax 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  ImportSalesTax
    Generic class for implementing an import duty that is assessed like a sales tax Identical in almost every way to SalesTax, just adds a check in ImportSalesTax.getTaxAmountFor(SellableItem) to return an amount of 0 if the item is not imported
    class  SalesTax
    Generic sales tax class Should be able to be used for most simple sales taxes in most jurisdictions
    Methods in com.teksystems.salestaxexercise.tax that return types with arguments of type Tax 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.util.LinkedHashSet<Tax> AbstractTaxJurisdiction.getAllTaxes()  
    java.util.LinkedHashSet<Tax> TaxJurisdiction.getAllTaxes()
    The list of taxes for a given jurisdiction must not contain any duplicate taxes and must be maintained in a particular order, as some taxes may be applied on top of other taxes prior to them on the list e.g., Quebec sales taxes are applied on top of the federal sales tax
    java.util.Map<Tax,​org.joda.money.Money> Taxable.getTaxAmounts()  
    java.util.Map<Tax,​org.joda.money.Money> TaxableItemImpl.getTaxAmounts()

    Methods in com.teksystems.salestaxexercise.tax with parameters of type Tax 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void TaxableItem.addTaxAmount​(Tax tax, org.joda.money.Money amount)
    You should not be able to directly add a tax amount to a taxable collection, their tax amounts should be made up of the tax amounts of the taxable items inside them
